hook.text: An electric motor converts electricity into spinning motion ‚Äî using magnets and wire.

buildup.text: When current flows through a wire inside a magnetic field, a force pushes the wire sideways.

discovery.text: By shaping the wire into a loop and letting it spin, you get continuous rotation ‚Äî a motor.

twist.text: A generator is just a motor running backward ‚Äî spin the shaft and you get electricity out.

climax.text: Electric motors are everywhere ‚Äî fans, cars, blenders, hard drives, elevators, and toys.

punchline.text: A motor is a magnet and wire. Spin it for electricity. Push current for motion.

quiz.question: What is the relationship between a motor and a generator?
